description: works as expected
Does what its made for, thanks!

It's a great little app, especially as a developer who takes and shares lots of screenshots - it definitely will save me lots of time.

Only negative is that when I drag screenshots into it it crashes, works fine taking the 'Open' route and selecting files though.
summary: Really easy to use and very quick

description: the scrolling is blinking and does not work
summary: does not function at all on debian at all

description: cant scroll if image is too tall
summary: works but unable to scroll large images

description: Takes less time than censoring stuff in Gimp.

It's a nice idea but the application freezes up on large images. Also, why was I seeing only a transparent layer added to the top of the image. Some of the text was still clearly visible under the white out.
either option (droplet and square) make the picutre disappear.
Does what it says, it's easy to use and works on gnome 40
summary: Easy to use, compatible with gnome 40

description: My only complaint is that when installed via Flathub on Fedora 35 dragging a screenshot from "Files" in Gnome onto the app did nothing. Using the open button worked fine.
Easy & Simple to use. Current Version (as of 2022-01-18) seems to be broken, as files cannot be dragged into the program and the "open" function must be used instead
A must have. Very easy to use and just does it jobs. Outstanding

I use Obfuscate to hide personal data from screenshots that I sometimes want to add to bug reports. Very useful.
Drag and drop however does not work in version 0.0.4 on Fedora 35 on GNOME Wayland. So I have to open the files via the menu.
summary: Handy program to protect your privacy

description: Straightforward! I like it. It offers blur and block-out which are useful for different circumstances.
A well-designed app that does exactly what it needs you to do. Perfect for censoring screenshots to remove personal information before posting them online.

The feature set is limited, as the only two things you can do are blurring and blacking out in a rectangle. Pixelation is not an option, despite the logo. It is incredibly easy and simple to use and I highly recommend it for quick and easy censorship.
summary: Not flexable, but does it's job great

description: The default blur obfuscation can easily be reversed. The default should really be a secure method of obfuscation (such as replacing with a solid colour, where information is actually destroyed). It looks like a lovely app but I can’t recommend it in its current form as someone who relies on the current blur might have their security compromised.
summary: Don’t rely on the default obfuscation

description: Crashes after loading an image
good and easy to use
No fuss way to get some basic redaction for collaberaton
This app works great if you just want to quickly sensor some information from a document or blur someone's face in a photo. I highly recommend it.
Super convenient and easy to use on mobile devices!

Der Blur-Effekt, der über die zu anonymisierenden Teile des Bildes gelegt wird, funktioniert leider nicht richtig. Der darunter liegende Text war zwar etwas heller, aber immer noch gut lesbar. Ich hätte das fertige Bild außerdem gerne als JPG exportiert, aber dabei wurde nur die Endung ».jpg« an eine PNG-Datei gehängt. Hier wäre noch Verbesserungspotenzial.
Wenn man schnell auf nen Screenshot etwas Zensieren will das geht das mit dieser App schnell und einfach. Im ganzen bin ich sehr zufrieden mit der App.
Cumple con su cometido

La función de arrastrar y soltar una imagen para editarla lo funciona.
Has de hacerlo mediante el menú Abrir.
Probado en Ubuntu 20.04 LTS con Gnome 3.36.

es una buena idea util, pero pienso que puede mejorar un poco permitiendo abrir archivos desde el menu de nautilus (abrir con...) y ademas de agarrar imagen y arrastrarla dentro del programa, esas 2 cosas facilitarían la labor. Gracias!
ce que je pense : bien
Со своей задачей справляется.
summary: Отлично, но функционала бы чуть побольше
